English: Foreign Policy Initiative

For many years the socialists and liberals have lived in a fairy land of idealism, trusting such preposterous institutions as the League of Nations and the Workers’ International. It is time for a pure and glorious national foreign policy.
French: Depuis de nombreuses annйes, socialistes comme libйraux vivent dans un pays utopique et fйerique, accordant leur confiance а des institutions ridicules comme la Ligue des Nations et l’Internationale des Ouvriers L’heure d’une politique йtrangиre nationale pure et glorieuse est arrivйe.
Italian: Per molti anni i socialisti e i liberali hanno vissuto in un mondo di artefatto idealismo, dando fiducia a ridicole istituzioni quali la Lega delle Nazioni e L'Organizzazione Internazionale dei Lavoratori. И giunto il momento di introdurre una politica estera che dia prestigio e gloria alla nostra nazione.
Spanish: Durante muchos aсos, los socialistas y los liberales han vivido en un paнs de fantasнa e idealismo, confiando en absurdas instituciones como la Sociedad de Naciones y la Internacional de Trabajadores. Ya es hora de tener una polнtica exterior nacional pura y gloriosa.
German: Seit vielen Jahren schon leben die Sozialisten und Liberalen in einer idealistischen Traumwelt, die solch angesehenen Institutionen wie der Vцlker- und Arbeiterbund (League of Nations und Workers) (International vertraut. Die Zeit fьr eine eindeutige und glorreiche nationale AuЯenpolitik ist gekommen.
Polish: Przez wiele lat socjaliњci i liberaіowie їyli w nierzeczywistym њwiecie idealizmu, ufaj№c takim zakіamanym instytucjom jak Liga Narodуw czy Miкdzynarodуwka. Nadszedі czas wprowadzenia czystej i chwalebnej polityki zagranicznej.
Russian: Долгие годы социалисты и либералы предавались идеалистическим иллюзиям и уповали на роль таких нелепых организаций, как Лига Наций и Рабочий Интернационал. Теперь пришло время жесткой и реалистичной внешней политики.

English: Foreign Policy attacked by the opposition
French: La Politique йtrangиre attaquйe par l’opposition
Spanish: La polнtica exterior es atacada por la oposiciуn

English: Our current Foreign Policy is under harsh attack from socialists, liberals and extremists.
French: Notre Politique йtrangиre actuelle est vivement attaquйe par les socialistes, les libйraux et les extrйmistes.
Italian: La nostra attuale politica estera sta subendo un aspro attacco da parte dei socialisti, dei liberali e degli estremisti.
Spanish: Nuestra actual polнtica exterior estб siendo atacada por los socialistas, los liberales y los extremistas.
German: Unsere aktuelle AuЯenpolitik wird von den Sozialisten, Liberalen und Extremisten scharf verurteilt.
Polish: Nasza obecna polityka zagraniczna jest ostro atakowana przez socjalistуw, liberaіуw i ekstremistуw.
Russian: Наша внешняя политика подвергается нападкам социалистов, либералов и экстремистов.

English: Law Policy Initiative

For many years, Socialists and Liberals have run amok with the legislative system. Illusory concepts such as human rights and freedom from responsibility have created complete anarchy. We are now setting this country back on the right track with order, censorship and the good old rule of law.
French: Depuis de nombreuses annйes, les Socialistes et les Libйraux ont perdu tout contrфle du systиme lйgislatif. Des concepts illusoires comme les droits de l’homme et l’absence de responsabilitй ont gйnйrй l'anarchie la plus totale. Nous remettons aujourd’hui ce pays sur le droit chemin grвce а l’ordre, la censure et les bonnes vieilles rиgles lйgislatives.
Italian: Per molti anni, i socialisti e i liberali hanno gestito in modo folle il sistema legislativo. I concetti illusori come i diritti umani e la libertа dalle responsabilitа hanno portato a una totale anarchia. Adesso stiamo cercando di riportare questo paese sui giusti binari, ristabilendo l'ordine, la censura e il ripristino della legge.
Spanish: Durante muchos aсos, los socialistas y los liberales han sembrado el caos en el sistema legislativo. Conceptos ilusorios como los derechos humanos y la falta de responsabilidad han creado la anarquнa mбs absoluta. Ahora vamos a devolver a este paнs al camino correcto mediante el orden, la censura y el viejo y adecuado imperio de la ley.
German: Viele Jahre lang schon sind die Sozialisten und Liberalen mit der Legislative Amok gelaufen. Illusorische Konzepte wie z.B. Menschenrechte und freie Entscheidung haben eine totale Anarchie hervorgebracht. Wir bringen dieses Land jetzt durch Ordnung, Zensur und das gute alte Rechtssystem zurьck auf den rechten Weg.
Polish: Przez wiele lat socjaliњci i liberaіowie pozwalali sobie na dowoln№ manipulacjк systemem prawnym. Zіudne pojкcia, takie jak prawa czіowieka i wolnoњж jednostki daіy pocz№tek caіkowitej anarchii. Prostujemy to, co zostaіo skrzywione przez przywrуcenie porz№dku, cenzury i starych, dobrych rz№dуw prawa.
Russian: Долгие годы социалисты и либералы разрушали нашу законодательную систему. Жонглирование абстрактными понятиями, вроде прав человека и свободы от ответственности, привели к полной анархии. Теперь мы возвращаемся на путь старой доброй законности, порядка и цензуры.

English: Law Policy attacked by the opposition
French: La Politique pйnale attaquйe par l’opposition
Spanish: La polнtica legislativa es atacada por la oposiciуn

English: Our current Law Policy is under harsh attack from socialists, liberals and extremists.
French: Notre Politique pйnale actuelle est vivement attaquйe par les socialistes, les libйraux et les extrйmistes.
Italian: La nostra attuale politica legislativa sta subendo un aspro attacco da parte dei socialisti, dei liberali e degli estremisti.
Spanish: Nuestra actual polнtica legislativa estб siendo atacada por los socialistas, los liberales y los extremistas.
German: Unsere aktuelle Rechtspolitik wird von den Sozialisten, Liberalen und Extremisten scharf verurteilt.
Polish: Nasza obecna polityka prawna jest ostro atakowana przez socjalistуw, liberaіуw i ekstremistуw.
Russian: Наша законодательная политика подвергается нападкам социалистов, либералов и экстремистов.

English: Constitutional Policy Initiative
Democracy has not fared well under the rule of levelling and egoism. It is time we find its essence, by conservative reform under the formula - Progress without change.
French: La dйmocratie est loin d’avoir prospйrй sous le rиgne de l’йgoпsme et de l’йgalitй. Il est temps pour nous d’en trouver l’essence, en introduisant une rйforme conservatrice dont le fil directeur sera ‘Progresser sans changer’.
Italian: La democrazia non ha funzionato applicando le regole di paritа ed egoismo. И ora di trovare la sua essenza, con una riforma che segua la formula: progresso senza cambiamento.
Spanish: A la democracia no le ha ido bien bajo el gobierno de la igualdad y el egoнsmo. Es hora de que hallemos su esencia mediante una reforma conservadora con la fуrmula de 'progreso sin cambio'.
German: Die Demokratie hat es unter dem Versuch der Egalisierung und des Egoismus nicht weit gebracht. Es wird Zeit, dass wir uns auf die Grundlagen besinnen - durch konservative Reformen frei nach der Formel Fortschritt ohne Verдnderungen.
Polish: Demokracja nie zaszіa daleko pod rz№dami niwelacji i egoizmu. Czas juї najwyїszy na przywrуcenie jej istoty, dziкki konserwatywnym reformom pod hasіem 'Postкp bez zmian'.
Russian: Демократия не является царством уравниловки и эгоизма. Суть подлинной демократии необходимо восстановить по консервативной формуле 'Прогресс без изменений'.

English: Constitutional Policy attacked by the opposition
French: La Politique constitutionnelle attaquйe par l’opposition
Spanish: La polнtica constitucional es atacada por la oposiciуn
German: Die konstitutionelle Politik von der Opposition angegriffen

English: Our current Constitutional Policy is under harsh attack from extremists. We must now defend democracy.
French: Notre Politique constitutionnelle actuelle est vivement attaquйe par les extrйmistes. Nous devons а prйsent dйfendre la dйmocratie.
Italian: La nostra attuale politica costituzionale sta subendo un forte attacco da parte degli estremisti. Dobbiamo difendere la democrazia.
Spanish: Nuestra actual polнtica constitucional estб siendo atacada por los extremistas. Ahora debemos defender la democracia.
German: Unsere aktuelle konstitutionelle Politik wird von den Extremisten scharf verurteilt. Wir mьssen jetzt die Demokratie verteidigen.
Polish: Nasza obecna polityka konstytucyjna jest ostro atakowana przez socjalistуw, liberaіуw i ekstremistуw.
Russian: Наша конституционная политика подвергается нападкам экстремистов. Настало время защитить демократию.

English: What this country needs right now is a defense that is fiscally sound and is constructed around the citizenry. Our defense industry must also be allowed a role in creating a new defense to ensure competence and technological soundness.
French: Ce dont notre pays a besoin aujourd’hui, c’est d’une politique de dйfense йlaborйe autour de la citoyennetй, et а la fiscalitй solide. Pour que nos compйtences et notre technologies soient saines, notre industrie de la dйfense doit pouvoir avoir un rфle dans la crйation d’une nouvelle dйfense.
Italian: Ciт che serve al nostro paese in questo momento и una solida difesa, costruita intorno alla cittadinanza. La nostra industria della difesa deve anche avere un ruolo nella creazione di una nuova forza difensiva efficace da un punto di vista di competenze e tecnologia.
Spanish: Lo que este paнs necesita ahora mismo es una defensa fiscalmente sуlida y construida alrededor de la ciudadanнa. Ademбs, a nuestra industria militar se le debe dar un papel en la creaciуn de una nueva defensa para asegurar la competencia y la solidez tecnolуgica.
German: Was dieses Land jetzt braucht ist eine grundlegende Verteidigung, die von den Bьrgern ausgeht. Unserer Verteidigungsindustrie muss auch eine Rolle bei der Schaffung neuer Verteidigungsstrategien zugestanden werden um Kompetenz und technologische Haltbarkeit zu sichern.
Polish: To, czego nasz kraj w tej chwili potrzebuje, to obrona na ktуr№ nas staж oraz silnie powi№zana z obywatelami. Nasz przemysі obronny musi takїe wzi№ж udziaі w tworzeniu nowych struktury, by zapewniж nam kompetencjк i sprawnoњж technologiczn№.
Russian: Сейчас наша страна нуждается в финансово обеспеченной оборонной политике, обеспечивающей военную подготовку населения. Необходимо всячески развивать оборонную промышленность, привлекать первоклассные кадры и осваивать новые технологии.

English: The unlimited spending and inefficient regulations of both Conservatives and Socialists have hurt our economy. We must now ensure free trade and an economy free of state interventionism.
French: Les dйpenses effrйnйes et la rйglementation inefficace des Conservateurs et des Socialistes ont mis notre йconomie а mal . Nous devons aujourd’hui garantir le libre йchange et une йconomie libre de tout interventionnisme d’йtat.
Italian: Le ingenti spese e le regolamentazioni inefficienti di matrice conservatrice e socialista hanno danneggiato la nostra economia. Dobbiamo garantire il libero commercio e un'economia libera da interventismi.
Spanish: El gasto ilimitado y las regulaciones ineficaces de los conservadores y los socialistas han daсado nuestra economнa. Ahora debemos asegurar el libre comercio y una economнa sin intervencionismo del estado.
German: Die unbegrenzten Ausgaben und die ineffizienten Regelungen der Konservativen und Sozialisten haben unserer Wirtschaft schweren Schaden zugefьgt. Wir mьssen jetzt den freien Handel und eine Wirtschaft sichern, die frei ist von jeglicher staatlicher Intervention.
Polish: Nielimitowane wydatki i nieefektywna regulacja ze strony zarуwno konserwatystуw, jak i socjalistуw, zaszkodziіy naszej gospodarce. Musimy promowaж wolny handel i model ekonomiczny wolny od regulacji paсstwowych.
Russian: Наша экономика очень пострадала от безудержного роста государственных расходов и неэффективного законодательства. В этом виновны и консерваторы, и социалисты. Мы должны перейти к свободному рынку и прекратить государственное вмешательство в экономику.

English: Meddling in the affairs of other nations is not in the interest of this great nation. We had better run our own business and ensure freedom and opportunity for our citizens and not embroil ourselves in foreign conflicts.
French: Se mкler des affaires des autres nations n’est pas dans l’intйrкt de ce grand pays. Mieux vaut gйrer nos propres affaires, garantir а nos citoyens libertй et opportunitйs, et ne pas nous laisser entraоner dans des conflits йtrangers.
Italian: Intromettersi negli affari di altre nazioni non и nell'interesse di questo grande paese. И preferibile gestire al meglio i nostri affari e assicurare libertа e opportunitа per i cittadini, piuttosto che restare coinvolti in conflitti esterni.
Spanish: No es provechoso para esta gran naciуn el entrometerse en los asuntos de otros paнses. Serнa mejor ocuparnos de nuestros propios asuntos y garantizar la libertad y las oportunidades para nuestros ciudadanos, y no enzarzarnos en conflictos externos.
German: Sich in die Affдren anderer Nationen einzumischen ist nicht das Ziel dieser groЯartigen Nation. Wir sollten uns besser um unsere eigenen Probleme kьmmern und unseren Bьrgern Freiheit und Wohlstand sichern und uns nicht in auЯenpolitische Konflikte einmischen.
Polish: Mieszanie siк do w sprawy innych paсstw nie leїy w interesie naszego wspaniaіego narodu. Musimy bardziej pilnowaж wіasnego podwуrka i zapewniж dobrobyt naszym obywatelom, zamiast wikіaж siк w cudze kіopoty.
Russian: Наше великое государство не заинтересовано во вмешательстве в дела других стран. Нам следует больше заниматься своими делами и обеспечивать свободу и равные возможности нашим гражданам, а не впутываться в международные конфликты.

English: We denounce class society, be it aristocracy or communism. Man was born naturally equal and free. The state must now refrain from meddling in the life of the ordinary citizen.
French: Nous dйnonзons la sйparation des classes, qu’elle soit aristocratique ou communiste. Tous les hommes naissent libres et йgaux. L’йtat doit dйsormais йviter de se mкler de la vie du citoyen ordinaire.
Italian: Denunciamo la societа classista, sia essa aristocratica o comunista. L'uomo nasce uguale e libero. I cittadini devono esseri liberi dalle ingerenze dello stato.
Spanish: Condenamos la sociedad de clases, ya sea aristocracia o comunismo. El hombre naciу originariamente igual y libre. Ahora el estado debe abstenerse de intervenir en la vida del ciudadano ordinario.
German: Wir verurteilen die Klassengesellschaft, unabhдngig davon ob sie aristokratisch oder kommunistisch ausgelegt ist. Alle Menschen sind von Geburt an gleich und frei. Der Staat muss sich aus dem Leben der normalen Bьrger des Landes raushalten.
Polish: Wyrzekamy siк spoіeczeсstwa klasowego, czy to arystokracji, czy komunizmu. Czіowiek rodzi siк wolny i rуwny innym. Paсstwo musi przestaж wtr№caж siк do їycia swoich obywateli.
Russian: Мы осуждаем классовый подход к обществу. Нам не нужна ни аристократия, ни коммунистические схемы. Все люди рождаются равными и свободными. Государство должно перестать вмешиваться в частную жизнь граждан.

English: Democracy needs freedom and justice to flourish. These core values have been abused by both Socialists and Conservatives in the effort to control and strangle the individual in our country. Let us therefore rebuild democracy.
French: Pour prospйrer, la dйmocratie a besoin de libertй et de justice. Les Socialistes comme les Conservateurs ont abusй de ces valeurs essentielles, avides de contrфler et d’йtrangler les citoyens de notre pays. Il nous faut donc reconstruire la dйmocratie.
Italian: La democrazia ha bisogno di libertа e giustizia per prosperare. Questi valori fondamentali sono stati sfruttati da socialisti e conservatori per poter controllare e soffocare ogni individuo di questo paese. Per questo, impegniamoci tutti per ricostruire la democrazia.
Spanish: La democracia necesita libertad y justicia para prosperar. Tanto los socialistas como los conservadores han abusado de estos valores centrales en su esfuerzo por controlar y estrangular al individuo en nuestro paнs. Por consiguiente, reconstruiremos la democracia.
German: Die Demokratie baut auf Freiheit und Gerechtigkeit. Diese Kernwerte wurden sowohl von den Sozialisten als auch von den Konservativen bei ihren Bemьhungen verletzt, die Bьrger in unserem Land zu kontrollieren und zu ьberwachen. Wir sollten daher die Demokratie wieder aufbauen.
Polish: Demokracja wymaga do rozkwitu wolnoњci i sprawiedliwoњci. Te podstawowe wartoњci zostaіy sponiewierane przez socjalistуw i konserwatystуw w celu osi№gniкcia kontroli i zduszenia indywidualizmu jednostki – zbudujmy wiкc demokracjк od nowa.
Russian: Демократическое общество может процветать только в условиях свободы и справедливости. Этими основными ценностями пренебрегают и социалисты, и консерваторы. Они пытаются контролировать и душить индивидуальную свободу. Давайте вернемся к подлинной демократии.

English: The Old Right talks about defense, but it is not defense they are planning for, but war. They are hawkish and arrogant. We need a professional defense of high quality, but our conviction is that peace can only be assured by means of diplomacy and international cooperation.
French: La Vieille Droite parle de dйfense, pourtant ce n’est pas une dйfense qu’il prйparent, mais la guerre. Quels bellicistes arrogants ! Nous avons besoin d’une dйfense professionnelle de la plus grande qualitй, mais sommes convaincus que la paix ne peut кtre garantie que par la coopйration internationale et la diplomatie.
Italian: Il Vecchio Diritto parla di difesa, ma qui nessuno sta pianificando una difesa, piuttosto una guerra. Sono aguzzini arroganti. Abbiamo bisogno di una difesa professionale di alta qualitа, ma siamo convinti che la pace possa essere raggiunta solo tramite la diplomazia e la collaborazione internazionale.
Spanish: La vieja derecha habla de defenderse, pero no es eso lo que tienen en mente, sino la guerra. Son arrogantes e intransigentes. Necesitamos una defensa profesional de gran calidad, pero creemos que la paz sуlo puede asegurarse mediante la diplomacia y la cooperaciуn internacional.
German: Die Alten Rechte sprechen von Verteidigung, es ist jedoch keine Verteidigung die sie planen, sondern Krieg. Das ist wucherisch und arrogant. Wir benцtigen dringend eine professionelle und qualitativ hochwertige Verteidigung, aber unsere Ьberzeugung ist auch, dass der Frieden nur durch Diplomatie und internationale Zusammenarbeit gesichert werden kann.
Polish: Stare prawa mуwi№ o obronie, ale w rzeczywistoњci maj№ na celu planowanie wojny. S№ butne i aroganckie. Potrzebujemy profesjonalnej i skutecznej obrony, ale uwaїamy їe pokуj mog№ zagwarantowaж tylko њrodki dyplomatyczne i miкdzynarodowa wspуіpraca.
Russian: Правые снова говорят об обороне, но думают только о войне. Как всегда, они агрессивны и самоуверенны. Нам нужна хорошо обученная и профессиональная армия, но мир можно сохранить только путем дипломатии и международного сотрудничества.

English: Our nation affirms the values of freedom and a free market. However, if 'freedom' is merely the right to choose where in this beautiful country one is free to starve, then we say no. We choose instead freedom and responsibility, which demand both a free market and a system of social security.
French: Notre nation s’attache aux valeurs de la libertй et du libre йchange. Toutefois, si ‘кtre libre’ dans ce magnifique pays veut dire ‘mourir de faim dans le lieu de son choix’, nous refusons cette libertй. Choisissons le type de responsabilitй et libertй pour lesquelles un marchй de libre йchange et un systиme de sйcuritй sociale sont indispensables.
Italian: La nostra nazione afferma i valori di libertа e libero mercato. A ogni modo, se per libertа si intende semplicemente poter scegliere dove, in questo bellissimo paese, si puт morire di fame, noi diciamo no. Noi scegliamo piuttosto la libertа e la responsabilitа, che richiedono entrambe sia un mercato libero che un sistema di sicurezza sociale.
Spanish: Nuestra naciуn garantiza los valores de la libertad y el libre mercado. No obstante, si la 'libertad' no es mбs que el derecho a elegir dуnde es uno libre de morir de hambre en este hermoso paнs, entonces decimos no. En vez de eso escogemos la libertad y la responsabilidad, que exigen tanto un mercado libre como un sistema de seguridad social.
German: Unsere Nation unterschreibt das Streben nach Freiheit und eines freien Marktes. Wenn 'Freiheit' jedoch nur bedeutet, dass es jedem in diesem wunderschцnen Land freisteht zu entscheiden, wo er an Hunger sterben wird, dann sagen wir dazu NEIN. Wir entscheiden uns stattdessen fьr Freiheit und Verantwortlichkeit, die sowohl einen freien Markt als auch ein System der sozialen Sicherheit erfordern.
Polish: Nasz narуd popiera wolnoњж i wolny rynek. Jeњli jednak 'wolnoњж' oznacza prawo wybrania miejsca w tym piкknym kraju, w ktуrym siк umrze z gіodu, to mуwimy stanowcze 'nie'. Wybieramy raczej wolnoњж i odpowiedzialnoњж, ktуre wymagaj№ zarуwno wolnego rynku, jak i systemu opieki spoіecznej.
Russian: Мы ценим свободный рынок. Но если эта 'свобода' означает свободу голодать, мы с этим не согласны. Наш выбор - свобода и ответственность, что означает и свободный рынок, и систему социальной защиты.

English: We cherish the weaker members of our society and hold them dear. But should freedom be so strangled that the economic pie were to shrink from year to year, then it would be irresponsible to insist that it be divided equally. We will create instead a balanced economic policy.
French: Notre sociйtй aime et sait reconnaоtre а leur juste valeur les plus faibles de nos citoyens. Mais si notre libertй devait кtre а tel point йtranglйe que le pain de notre йconomie venait а diminuer d’annйe en annйe, il serait irresponsable d’insister sur une division йgalitaire. Crйons une politique йconomique йquilibrйe.
Italian: Abbiamo a cuore i membri piщ deboli della nostra societа e siamo loro vicini. Ma la libertа и stata soffocata a tal punto che la torta economica si и ridotta di anno in anno, quindi и da incoscienti insistere sul fatto che vada divisa equamente. Dobbiamo invece creare una politica economica equilibrata.
Spanish: Apreciamos y estimamos a los miembros mбs dйbiles de nuestra sociedad. Pero si la libertad quedara tan estrangulada como para reducir de aсo en aсo el pastel de la economнa, entonces serнa irresponsable insistir en dividirlo equitativamente. En lugar de eso crearemos una polнtica econуmica equilibrada.
German: Wir kьmmern uns um die schwachen Mitglieder in unserer Gesellschaft. Aber sollte die Freiheit so weit beschnitten werden, dass der wirtschaftliche Kuchen von Jahr zu Jahr kleiner wird, dann wдre es unverantwortlich, weiter davon auszugehen, dass er in gleiche Teile aufgeteilt wird. Wir werden stattdessen eine ausgewogene Wirtschaftspolitik anstreben.
Polish: Nie walczymy ze sіabszymi czіonkami naszego spoіeczeсstwa. Ale czy rzeczywiњcie rozwуj ekonomiczny musi byж co roku hamowany przez wydatki na cele socjalne? Musimy pomyњleж o zmianie zbilansowania gospodarki.
Russian: Мы заботимся о слабых согражданах и не отказываем им в уважении. Но если ограничение экономических свобод ведет к уменьшению общественного пирога из года в год, то было бы безответственно настаивать на равном распределении. Необходимо проводить сбалансированную экономическую политику.

English: Warmongers have led our country for far too long. These are men who define the 'national interest' in terms of the number of foreigners they have trampled on. But we don't care about foreigners, we care only about our sons and daughters. We cannot accept them coming home in body bags. Thus, there will be no new wars. War must end.
French: Les bellicistes dirigent notre pays depuis beaucoup trop longtemps. Ces hommes dйfinissent ‘l’intйrкt national’ en terme de nombre d’йtrangers foulйs au pied. Peu importe les йtrangers, seuls nos fils et nos filles comptent. Nous ne pouvons accepter de les voir revenir dans des housses mortuaires. C’est pourquoi il n’y aura plus aucune nouvelle guerre. La guerre doit prendre fin.
Italian: I guerrafondai hanno governato il nostro paese per troppo tempo. Questi sono uomini che definiscono l'interesse del paese in termini di quanti stranieri hanno sconfitto. Ma a noi non interessa degli stranieri, pensiamo solo al bene dei nostri figli. Non possiamo accettare che tornino a casa nelle bare. Quindi, non ci saranno altre guerre. La guerra deve finire.
Spanish: 'Los belicistas han dirigido nuestro paнs durante demasiado tiempo. Son hombres que definen el 'interйs nacional' en funciуn de la cantidad de extranjeros que han pisoteado. Pero a nosotros no nos importan los extranjeros, sуlo nos preocupan nuestros hijos. No podemos aceptar que vuelvan a casa en ataъdes. Por tanto, no habrб mбs guerras. La guerra debe terminar.'
German: Die Kriegshetzer haben unser Land schon viel zu lange befehligt. Das sind die Mдnner, welche die 'nationalen Interessen' im Sinne der Anzahl der Auslдnder messen, die sie zertreten haben. Uns sind jedoch die Auslдnder weitgehend egal, was uns wichtig ist sind unsere Sцhne und Tцchter. Wir akzeptieren einfach nicht, dass sie in Leichensдcken nach Hause kommen. Es wird also keine neuen Kriege mehr geben. Der Krieg muss endlich aufhцren.
Polish: Zwolennicy wojny zbyt dіugo przewodzili naszym paсstwem. To ci, ktуrzy licz№ 'interes narodowy' w iloњci obcokrajowcуw, ktуrych zdeptali. Ale nas obcokrajowcy nie obchodz№, dla nas licz№ siк tylko nasi synowie i nasze cуrki. Nie moїemy dopuњciж, by wracali do swych domуw w trumnach. A wiкc nie bкdzie їadnych nowych wojen. Wojna musi siк skoсczyж.
Russian: Воинственные политики правили нами слишком долго. Этим людям кажется, что наши 'национальные интересы' заключаются в том, чтобы попирать интересы других государств. Нам нет дела до иностранцев, но нам небезразлична судьба наших сыновей и дочерей. Мы не хотим, чтобы они возвращались домой в гробах. Поэтому мы не хотим новых войн и требуем мира.

English: We do not trust an army that represents bourgeois society. We demand instead a Workers' Army, an army that can promote peace, not war. Such an army will never fight outside our borders, because it acts solely for defense and not as a vehicle of international imperialist capitalism, in contrast to the current force of capitalist mercenaries.
French: Nous ne faisons pas confiance en une armйe qui reprйsente la sociйtй bourgeoise. Nous exigeons en revanche une Armйe du peuple ouvrier, а mкme d’encourager la paix, pas la guerre. Une armйe de ce type ne combattra jamais hors de nos frontiиres, elle sera dйfensive, et а l’opposй de notre armйe actuelle, composйe de mercenaires capitalistes, elle n’aura pas le rфle de vйhicule du capitalisme impйrialiste international.
Italian: Non crediamo in un esercito che rappresenta la societа borghese. Chiediamo, invece, un esercito dei lavoratori, che possa promuovere la pace, non la guerra. Un esercito cosм composto non combatterа mai oltre i nostri confini, perchй agirа esclusivamente come strumento di difesa e non come mezzo del capitalismo imperialista internazionale, in opposizione all'esercito attuale composto da mercenari del capitalismo.
Spanish: No confiamos en un ejйrcito que representa a la sociedad burguesa. En su lugar exigimos un ejйrcito del proletariado, un ejйrcito que promueva la paz, no la guerra. Tal ejйrcito jamбs lucharнa fuera de nuestras fronteras, porque actuarнa ъnicamente para defender y no como vehнculo del capitalismo imperialista internacional, al contrario que la actual fuerza de mercenarios capitalistas.
German: Wir trauen keiner Armee, die eine bьrgerliche Gesellschaft reprдsentiert. Wir fordern stattdessen eine Arbeiterarmee, eine, die den Frieden propagiert, nicht den Krieg. Solch eine Armee wird nie auЯerhalb unserer Grenzen kдmpfen, da sie nur als Verteidigungsarmee dient und nicht als Mittel fьr internationalen imperialistischen Kapitalismus, ganz im Gegensatz zu den aktuellen Streitkrдften kapitalistischer Sцldner.
Polish: Nie ufamy armii reprezentuj№cej interesy burїuazji. Domagamy siк Armii Robotniczej, takiej, ktуra bкdzie promowaж pokуj, nie wojnк. Taka armia nie bкdzie nigdy walczyж poza naszymi granicami, gdyї dziaіaж bкdzie wyі№cznie w obronie, a nie jako narzкdzie miкdzynarodowego, imperialistycznego kapitalizmu.
Russian: Мы не доверяем буржуазной армии. Взамен нее мы требуем создать Рабочую Армию, которая будет стремиться к миру, а не к войне. Эта армия никогда не будет сражаться за пределами наших границ и никогда не станет орудием международного капитализма и империализма, в отличие от теперешней банды наемников капитала.

English: The Capitalists are oppressing us with devilish new economic instruments, such as free Trade, no regulation of trade, minimal taxes, and of course, no policies to promote equality. This makes them nothing but butchers and tyrants. But we will use taxes as an instrument for leveling this society. The upper classes will disappear - this we promise.
French: Les capitalistes nous oppressent avec de nouveaux outils йconomiques diaboliques comme le libre йchange, la dйrйglementation des йchanges commerciaux, de faibles impфts et bien entendu, une politique dйnuйe de lois promulguant l'йgalitй. Ceci fait tout simplement d’eux des bouchers et des tyrans. Nous allons adopter les taxes comme outils de nivellement de cette sociйtй. La classe supйrieure disparaоtra – nous vous en faisons la promesse.
Italian: I capitalisti ci stanno opprimendo usando subdoli strumenti della nuova economia, come libero mercato, nessuna regolamentazione per il commercio, tasse minime e, ovviamente, senza alcuna politica per promuovere l'uguaglianza. Per questo non sono altro che strozzini e tiranni. Ma noi useremo le tasse come strumento per livellare la societа. Le classi piщ elevate spariranno: questa и una promessa.
Spanish: Los capitalistas estбn oprimiйndonos con nuevos instrumentos diabуlicos como el libre comercio o los impuestos mнnimos y, por supuesto, no tienen polнtica que promueva la igualdad. Esto los convierte en carniceros y tiranos. Pero nosotros usaremos los impuestos como instrumento de equilibrio para esta sociedad. Las clases superiores desaparecerбn, lo prometemos.
German: Die Kapitalisten unterdrьcken uns mit teuflischen neuen wirtschaftlichen Mitteln, wie z.B. den freien Handel, keine Regelung des Handels, minimalen Steuern, und natьrlich auch keine Gesetzesvorlagen um die Gleichheit zu promovieren. Das fьhrt dazu, dass sie alle zu Metzgern und Tyrannen werden. Wir werden jedoch die Steuern nutzen, um diese Gesellschaft wieder auf ein gesundes MaЯ zu bringen. Die Oberschicht wird verschwinden - das versprechen wir.
Polish: Kapitaliњci uciskaj№ nas diabelskimi instrumentami nowej ekonomii, takimi jak wolny handel, brak regulacji, minimalne podatki i oczywiњcie brak polityki rуwnoњci. To czyni ich rzeџnikami i tyranami. My wykorzystamy podatki do wyrуwnania rуїnic bytowych spoіeczeсstwa. Wyїsze klasy znikn№ ostatecznie – to wam przyrzekamy.
Russian: Капиталисты душат рабочий класс при помощи новых дьявольских изобретений: свободного рынка, свободы торговли, минимальных налогов и, конечно, не заботятся о равенстве. Они просто убийцы и тираны. Мы же будем использовать налоги как инструмент установления равенства. Высших классов скоро не станет - мы твердо обещаем это.

English: Our working comrades abroad face harsh pressure from both Capitalist and Fascist regmes. We must prepare ourselves for the final battle, for we cannot stand idly by while workers' governments are toppled one by one.
French: Nos camarades ouvriers font face, а l’йtranger, а des pressions insupportables sous les rйgimes capitalistes et fascistes. Nous devons nous prйparer а la lutte finale, car nous ne pouvons rester les bras croisйs alors que des gouvernements ouvriers sont renversйs l’un aprиs l’autre.
Italian: I nostri compagni lavoratori stranieri stanno subendo pesanti pressioni dai regimi capitalista e fascista. Dobbiamo prepararci alla battaglia finale, poichй non possiamo piщ rimanere immobili a guardare mentre i governi dei lavoratori vengono fatti cadere uno a uno.
Spanish: Nuestros camaradas obreros en el extranjero se enfrentan a una fuerte presiуn de los regнmenes capitalista y fascista. Debemos prepararnos para la batalla final, porque no podemos permanecer impasibles mientras los gobiernos de los trabajadores son derrocados uno por uno.
German: Unsere arbeitenden Kameraden im Ausland leiden unter dem unglaublichen Druck der kapitalistischen und faschistischen Regimes. Wir mьssen uns auf den Endkampf vorbereiten, denn wir kцnnen nicht einfach dabeistehen und zusehen, wдhrend die Arbeiterregierungen eine nach der anderen gestьrzt werden.
Polish: Nasi towarzysze pracuj№cy za granic№ s№ uciskani zarуwno przez kapitalistуw, jak i faszystуw. Musimy przygotowaж siк do ostatecznej bitwy, nie moїemy staж bezczynnie podczas gdy rz№dy robotnicze s№ jeden po drugim obalane.
Russian: Наши братья по классу, иностранные рабочие, испытывают тяжкий гнет капиталистических и фашистских режимов. Мы должны готовиться к решающей схватке, ведь мы не можем просто смотреть, как враги свергают рабочие правительства поодиночке.

English: The Old Right talks about freedom, but what they don't say is that it is only the freedom of some and not the freedom of the many. True freedom can only exist where society is truly equal. 'Liberal' freedom is a misnomer that must be corrected.
French: La Vieille Droite parle de libertй, mais il s’agit de la libertй de quelques-uns, au dйtriment de la libertй des masses. La vraie libertй ne peut exister que dans une sociйtй rйellement йgalitaire. La libertй ‘libйrale’ est un terme impropre qu’il nous faut corriger.
Italian: Il Vecchio Diritto parla di libertа, ma quello che non dice и che si tratta di libertа solo di pochi, non della massa. La vera libertа puт esistere solo in una societа davvero eguale. La libertа 'liberale' и un termine improprio che va corretto.
Spanish: La vieja derecha habla de libertad, pero lo que no dicen es que es una libertad sуlo para algunos y no para muchos. La verdadera libertad sуlo puede existir en una sociedad igualitaria de verdad. La libertad 'liberal' es un nombre impropio que debe ser corregido.
German: Die Alten Rechte verkьnden die Freiheit - was sie aber verschweigen ist, dass es dabei nur um die Freiheit einiger weniger geht und nicht um die Freiheit von allen. Echte Freiheit kann nur dort bestehen, wo die Gesellschaft gleichgestellt ist. Die 'liberale' Freiheit ist ein unzutreffender Name, der korrigiert werden muss.
Polish: Stare prawa mуwi№ o wolnoњci, ale nie wyjaњniaj№, їe jest to wolnoњж kilku a nie wolnoњж wielu. Prawdziwa wolnoњж moїe istnieж tylko w spoіeczeсstwie prawdziwie rуwnym. 'Liberalna' wolnoњж to tylko bікdne okreњlenie, ktуre trzeba skorygowaж.
Russian: Правые снова говорят о свободе, но они молчат о том, это свобода для немногих и несвобода для большинства. Подлинная свобода существует только в государстве всеобщего равенства. 'Либеральная' свобода - это обман, и мы должны это исправить.

English: The Capitalists and Aristocrats, with their greed and corruption, have nearly destroyed democracy. We have no intention of rebuilding the injustices of bourgeois pseudodemocracy. We will build a real democracy, in which capitalists and aristocrats will be held on a short leash.
French: Les capitalistes et les aristocrates ont, avec leur corruption et leur aviditй, quasiment dйtruit la dйmocratie. Nous n’avons nullement l’intention de reproduire les injustices de la pseudo-dйmocratie bourgeoise. Nous construirons une vraie dйmocratie dans laquelle nous tiendrons la bride haute aux capitalistes et aux aristocrates.
Italian: I capitalisti e gli aristocratici, animati da aviditа e corruzione, hanno quasi distrutto la democrazia. Non abbiamo alcuna intenzione di restaurare le ingiustizie della pseudodemocrazia borghese. Costruiremo una democrazia vera, in cui i capitalisti e gli aristocratici non avranno il potere di dettare legge.
Spanish: Los capitalistas y los aristуcratas, con su avaricia y su corrupciуn, han destruido la democracia casi por completo. No tenemos intenciуn de reconstruir las injusticias de la pseudodemocracia burguesa. Construiremos una democracia real, en la que se atarб en corto a los capitalistas y los aristуcratas.
German: Die Kapitalisten und Aristokraten haben mit ihrer Gier und Korruption die Demokratie fast vernichtet. Wir sehen keinerlei Veranlassung, die Ungerechtigkeiten bьrgerlicher Pseudodemokratie wieder aufzubauen. Wir werden eine echte Demokratie aufbauen, in der Kapitalisten und Aristokraten gleichermaЯen an der kurzen Leine gehalten werden.
Polish: Kapitaliњci i arystokraci, w swej chciwoњci i korupcji, niemal zniszczyli demokracjк. Nie mamy zamiaru odbudowywaж niesprawiedliwoњci tej burїuazyjnej pseudodemokracji. Stworzymy prawdziw№ demokracjк, w ktуrej kapitaliњci i arystokraci bкd№ trzymani na krуtkiej smyczy.
Russian: Жадность и продажность капиталистов и аристократов поставили нашу демократию на край пропасти. Нам не нужно возвращаться к несправедливой буржуазной псевдодемократии. Мы построим подлинную демократию и укоротим загребущие руки капиталистов и аристократов.

English: Force it through
Strike a bargain with the Liberals
French: Conclure un marchй avec les libйraux
Italian: Concludere un accordo con i liberali
Spanish: Cerrar un acuerdo con los liberales

English: Strike a bargain with the Socialists
French: Conclure un marchй avec les socialistes
Italian: Concludere un accordo con i socialisti
Spanish: Cerrar un acuerdo con los socialistas

Ride out the storm
Strike a bargain with the Market Liberals
French: Conclure un marchй avec les libйralistes_
Italian: Concludere un accordo con i liberali del mercato
Spanish: Cerrar un acuerdo con los ultraliberales

English: Strike a bargain with the Leftists
French: Conclure un marchй avec les gauchistes
Italian: Concludere un accordo con la fazione di sinistra
Spanish: Cerrar un acuerdo con la izquierda

English: Revise the policy
Strike a bargain with the Ultrarightists

Los contratistas navales y los cientнficos nucleares han unido sus fuerzas, y el director del proyecto ha presentado los resultados teуricos al estado mayor. Se cree que una investigaciуn empнrica posterior podrнa llevar a una serie de submarinos nucleares.
German: Ein geheimes Projekt zeigt Ergebnisse. Schiffslieferanten und Nuklearwissenschaftler haben sich zusammengetan und der Projektmanager hat die theoretischen Ergebnisse dem Generalstab prдsentiert. Man glaubt, dass weitere empirische Forschung zu einer Serie atomar betriebener U-Boote fьhren kann.

It is believed that further empirical research can lead to a series of Helicopters, which can give us Air Cavalry Divisions

Les fournisseurs d’appareils et les tacticiens de l’йtat-major ont alliй leurs forces, et le chef de projet a prйsentй nos rйsultats thйoriques а l’Йtat Major gйnйral. Ci sono buone probabilitа che la successiva ricerca empirica porti alla realizzazione di una serie di elicotteri, in grado di fornirci divisioni di cavalleria aerea.

It is believed that further empirical research can lead to a series of ASM, which will give us CAS aircraft with superior naval attack capabilities

Les constructeurs navals, les constructeurs d’appareils et les constructeurs de missiles ont alliй leurs forces, et le chef de projet a prйsentй nos rйsultats thйoriques а l’Йtat Major gйnйral. Se cree que una investigaciуn empнrica posterior podrнa llevar a una serie de misiles aire-tierra, que nos proporcionarнan aviaciуn de apoyo de proximidad con mayores capacidades de ataque naval
German: Ein geheimes Projekt zeigt Ergebnisse. Man glaubt, dass weitere empirische Forschung zu einer Serie von Schiffsabwehrraketen (ASM) fьhren kann, die uns zu SF-Flugzeugen mit ьberlegener Marineangriffsfдhigkeit fьhren kann.
Polish: Tajny projekt wydaі owoce. Producenci statkуw i samolotуw oraz inїynierowie rakietowi poі№czyli siіy, a menedїer projektu zaprezentowaі teoretyczne wyniki naczelnemu dowуdztwu. Uwaїa siк, їe dalsze badania empiryczne doprowadz№ do stworzenia broni przeciwko okrкtom podwodnym, co znacz№co poprawi przeciwokrкtowe zdolnoњci naszych samolotуw CAS.

It is believed that further empirical research can lead to a series of SAMs, which will give us highly flexible and powerful Anti-Aircraft Batteries

Les fournisseurs d’appareils et les constructeurs de missiles ont alliй leurs forces, et le chef de projet a prйsentй nos rйsultats thйoriques а l’Йtat Major gйnйral. On estime que des recherches inductives supplйmentaires pourraient gйnйrer toute une sйrie de SAM, qui nous donneront des batteries antiaйriennes extrкmement flexibles et puissantes.

I produttori di aeromobili e navi egli ingegneri missilistici hanno unito le loro forze e il responsabile del progetto ha presentato i risultati allo Stato Maggiore. Ci sono buone probabilitа che la successiva ricerca empirica porti alla realizzazione di una serie di SAM, che possono fornirci batterie antiaeree molto flessibili e potenti.
Spanish: Un proyecto secreto ha fructificado. Los contratistas de aviaciуn y los ingenieros de cohetes han unido sus fuerzas, y el director del proyecto ha presentado los resultados teуricos al estado mayor. Se cree que una investigaciуn empнrica posterior podrнa llevar a una serie de misiles tierra-aire que nos proporcionarнan baterнas antiaйreas enormemente flexibles y poderosas.

Man glaubt, dass weitere empirische Forschung zu einer Serie Luft-Land-Raketen (SAM) fьhren kann, die zu hochflexiblen und leistungsstarken Flugabwehrbatterien fьhren kann.

Uwaїa siк, їe dalsze badania empiryczne doprowadz№ do stworzenia rakiet ziemia-powietrze, co da nam wysoce elastyczne i silne baterie przeciwlotnicze.

English: A secret project has borne fruit. Aircraft contractors and turbojet engineers have joined forces and the project manager has presented the theoretical results to the General Staff. It is believed that further empirical research can lead to a series of Turbojet Fighters
French: Un projet secret a portй ses fruits. Les fournisseurs d’appareils et les ingйnieurs de turborйacteur ont alliй leurs forces, et le chef de projet a prйsentй nos rйsultats thйoriques а l’Йtat Major gйnйral. On estime que des recherches inductives supplйmentaires pourraient gйnйrer toute une sйrie d’avions de combat а turborйacteur.

I produttori di aeromobili e gli ingegneri di turboreattori hanno unito le loro forze e il responsabile del progetto ha presentato i risultati teorici allo Stato Maggiore. Ci sono buone probabilitа che la successiva ricerca empirica porti alla realizzazione di una serie di aerei caccia a turbogetto.

English: The 1936 TUC Congress has been opened with much fanfare. This is the most important political event of the year, as it is now that new ministers are appointed and (although it is not explicitly mentioned) changes in Union policy are made and announced. This years congress will probably be a bit special though. Long-time TUC chairman Philip Snowden has long indicated that he intends to withdraw following this congress, and the stakes are high. Rivalling factions are forming behind the curtains, and the decentralizationist Authonomists, led by Niclas y Glais, centralizationist Maximists (Oswald Mosley), status quo socialist Federationists (Arthur Horner) and radical egalitarian paci-isolationist Congregationalists (Annie Kenney) are all wying for superiority in the TUC. Whatever the outcome, this will surely be a thing to remember...

After the Franco- German war of 1870 to 1871, the Sedantag was established in Germany to celebrate the 1870 victory in the battle of Sedan. Originally a holiday to honour the Prussian military, the Sedantag transformed under the reign of Wilhelm II into a day to celebrate the foundation of the German empire, and after the Weltkrieg the defeat of those forces that tried to destroy the Reich. Thoughout every town and village from Aachen to Memel, every street is decorated in black, white, and red. Every bell proudly proclaims this day of celebration. Nobilitiy, officers, soldiers, and unnumbered veterans parade proudly thought the streets, cheered by the happy masses. People sing patriotic songs, have pickniks with friends and family, play music, and dance around bonfires. Indeed, this is a good day, a day that reminds us of the peace and prosperity we have enjoyed since the german unification.

Luise Hoffmann was the first German woman to gain a pilot's license. After her 1933 transatlantic solo flight and her role as a scout pilot in the 1936 Neuschwabenland Expedition, she has become one of Germany's most famous aviation pioneers, along with notable pilots like Manfred von Richthofen, and Gunther Pluschow. Today, Fraulein Hoffmann has acomplished a new long distance record in her customized Fokker F-IX. Starting in Tahiti 36 hours ago, Fraulein Hoffmann today landed savely in Lae on German New Guinea, where she was welcomed by a jubilous crowd and governor Albert Hahl. It is rumored by now that Hoffmann will soon attempt a solo flight around the world. This would place her at a direct competition with the Red Baron who is planning a similar endeavour.

Today the Australasian Labour Party convened a special session in Sydney where the former premier of New South Wales, Jack Lang, was readmitted into the party after having been excluded for 5 years. Lang was originally excluded as a result of his dismissal from government by the contemporary governor of NSW, Philip Game. A powerful orator and a populist through and through, the readmittance of Lang has caused consternation amongst the more leftist members of the Labour Party who alongside the majority of trade union activists see him more as a social feudalist inherently hostile to true socialist doctrine. It seems that the Australasian Labour Party is heading into a turbulent time.

Both Australia and New Zealand had a troubled relationship with the idea of conscription during the Weltkrieg. In Australia, two consecutive plebsticies about the introduction of conscription were narrowly defeated, leaving the ANZACs and other Antipodean units strictly volunteer-only. However, with the Entente’s defeat and the ensuring German expansion in the Pacific following the 1925 British Revolution, the federal government has been anxious about strengthening the fighting capabilities of the Australasian army, navy and air force. Today, the incumbent government of Billy Hughes has proposed increasing the military’s training strength and funding as a result of the rising tension in Europe and Asia. Some see it as a staging point for the government to launch a campaign arguing for the introduction of conscription and the need for a swift militarization of the Antipodean dominions.

The exiled ‘White Rajah’ of Sarawak and noted Sydney socialite, Charles Vyner Brooke has now openly begun to associate with the reactionary grouping known as ‘the New Guard’ led by Weltkrieg veteran Eric Campbell. Until now, the Guard has been a minor force in Australasian politics, but with their  forceful revanchist rhetoric and populist flair the movement has begun to spread its influence beyond New South Wales, especially gaining support amongst discharged servicemen and disgruntled officers. With Brooke’s charm and considerable monetary resources, the New Guard might just have gained the staging point for a showdown with the supposedly complacent and stagnating policies of Hughes and Bruce. The government should be prepared for any eventuality.

Conscription has always been a touchy subject in the Antipodean Dominions. Several governments had attempted to enforce it through plebiscites, but were defeated - sometimes narrowly - at the polling stations. However, several leading members of the incumbent administration argue that the time has come for a new attempt at replacing the volunteer ANZAC forces with a conscription-based and better trained armed forces. Such a ‘conscription campaign’ could either strengthen the government if successful or potentially break it - and thus strengthening the extremes of Australasia’s political scene - if failing. Either way, the amount of money the government is prepared to spend on this campaign will be an indicator of failure as well as success.

As the votes were being counted it soon became clear that the Yay-side would carry the day. However, complications have arisen since New Zealand overwhelmingly voted no to confederate conscription whilst Australians mainly voted yes. Although a majority for conscription has been achieved, it would be dangerous for our nation’s union to impose it on the New Zealanders. Some members of cabinet have proposed that we let the various administrative regions implement conscription on a local level, thus allowing the Kiwis to maintain their volunteer-based army units.

Since Jack Lang’s readmittance in February, the Labour Party has been steaming with internal disputes. Today, Lang struck back at the leftist members of the New South Wales party branch, successfully having them excluded alongside their Syndicalist-friendly trade union comrades from the party. This purge of the NSW party has since rippled throughout the Confederation with Lang’s supporters of moderate social populists and anti-Syndicalist union supporters ostracizing and marginalizing their more leftist opponents. This ‘Great Schism’ of the Australasian Labour Party has firmly separated the Antipodean worker’s movement into a reformist and populist rump Labour Party and a revolutionary movement consolidating around the Australasian Council of Trade Unions. Yet all is not well in Labour since friction still exists between Lang and the popular John J. Curtin.

These are violent and turbulent times we are all living in. There are many threats to the west, to the north and to the east that endanger the independence and sovereignty of us and our neighbours. To the east, Afghanistan, threatened by the eventual war in India that will spill over into their borders and Azerbaijan to the North, whose oil fields in Baku are vunerable and a large priority for the Ottomans and the Russians both. We have come up with an idea, a treaty we can propose to both of our neighbours. The treaty will guarantee all of our independence and we will enter a pact on Non-aggression.

Persia has proposed a treaty. In it, we guarantee their independence and Afghanistan's and we enter a Non-Aggression pact with them both. Our oil fields in the Baku Province are some of the largest in the World, making us one of the most threatened countries in the World. We may need Persia and Afghanistan for protection.

Persia has proposed a treaty. In it, we guarantee their independence and Azerbaijan's and we enter a Non-Aggression pact with them both. Soon, there will very likely be a war between Delhi, the Princely Federation and the Bhartiya Commune over the Indian Subcontinent, and it is also very likely to spill into our borders. We may need Persia and Azerbaijan for protection.

Persia has proposed a treaty. In it, we guarantee their independence and we enter a Non-Aggression pact with the Shah. Our oil fields in the Baku Province are some of the largest in the World, making us one of the most threatened countries in the World. We may need Persia for protection.

Persia has proposed a treaty. In it, we guarantee their independence and we enter a Non-Aggression pact with the Shah. Soon, there will very likely be a war between Delhi, the Princely Federation and the Bhartiya Commune over the Indian Subcontinent, and it is also very likely to spill into our borders. We may need Persia for protection.

Twenty-five years since the end of the Persian Constitutional Revolution, Qajar Persia remains a country struggling with internal fragmentation. The constitutional monarchy’s government is mostly stable thanks to the efforts of prime minister Nosrat ed-Dowleh and his predecessor Abdulhusayn Teymurtash, but the army is divided between the pro-German gendarmerie and the Entente-aligned Cossack Division, whose former commander Reza Khan still lurks in the shadows of ambition since his dismissal for brutality in 1921. The clergy and the modernists engage in daily political battles in the Majles regarding the pace of reforms and the French backed socialist Hezb-e Tudeh Iran maintains a worrying underground presence in the countryside. The current parliamentary mandate is due to expire in 1937 and many fear what fresh elections will bring troubled Persia...

The Persian army has been in a terrible state ever since the Constitutional Revolution. The officers of the Cossack Brigade continue to argue with their counterparts in the Gendarmerie over the question of tactics and doctrines, making the army divisions ineffective and divided. If the next election is to proceed amicably and the Qajar dynasty retain the throne, the feud between the various corps will have to cease. His majesty will have to make a decision. Should we support the firepower doctrine of the pro-German gendarmerie or support the light infantry pro-Entente Cossacks?

Election Day has finally come to Persia! From Tehran to Shiraz and from the Mesopotamian border to the peaks of the Hindukush the electorate is scuttling to cast their vote. Four major parties are standing for election. Furthest to the right is the Traditionalist coalition of conservative nobles and reactionary members of the ulema. More moderate and progressive, the Revival Party of former premier Teymourtash campaigns for a more efficient and liberal administration while favouring free market economics. Current finance minister Mosaddegh is leading the centre-left National Front whilst the most leftist party allowed to run is the social democratic Democrat Party. The polls are unable to predict any winner and as such the people are awaiting the results eagerly.

Ukraine, a Former territory of the Russian Empire has fallen to the Syndicalsts. Led by that boar Khruschev, they have already begun to redistribute the land. They are a threat to the stability of the region, and it would be in our best interests to reincorporate them...but...it may be safer to first gain German permission before entering in any military campaigns in the territory of their former ally. The foreign minister has come up with a treaty that we can propose to the Kaiser. In exchange for giving us a free-hand in Ukraine, we will enter in a mutual defence agreement.

A Historic Day, The Golden Gate Bridge of San Francisco was completed by Joseph Strauss and his team of engineers. It connects the city of San Francisco on the northern tip of the San Francisco Peninsula to Marin County as part of US Highway 101 and California State Highway 1. The Golden Gate Bridge is the largest suspension bridge in the world and reporters and journalists from all over have come to the Grand Opening which will be held next week amidst the political turmoil and crisis in the Midwest, a stark contrast to the situation and economic prosperity that has been seen by the West which this bridge has become a symbol of.

A Historic Day, The Golden Gate Bridge of San Francisco was completed by Joseph Strauss and his team of engineers. It connects the city of San Francisco on the northern tip of the San Francisco Peninsula to Marin County as part of US Highway 101 and California State Highway 1. The Golden Gate Bridge is the largest suspension bridge in the world and reporters and journalists from all over the World have come to the Grand Opening which will be held next week. The New Government of California, after having recently broken off from the United States of America has made this new bridge a symbol of it's government and its prosperity.

In Detroit, Michigan, Automotive Capital of the World, leaders of the United Auto Workers Walter Reuther and Richard Frankensteen called a general strike against the Ford Motor Company and begin which they called "Unionism, Not Fordism," demanding higher pay and less hours. At 2:00 PM today, a photographer from the Detroit Free Press asked to take a photo of the Leaders of the UAW standing on the overpass with the Ford sign in the background. While they were posing, 40 men with batons from the Ford's Service Department, an internal security force came from behind and began to beat them. The group then beat some of the beret-wearing women arriving to pass out leaflets.

A Heat Wave has struck the Continental United States and Canada, the most severe heat wave in the Modern History of North America. 'The Great Heat Wave' started in late June, went up over 100°F (38°C) as the Drought conditions worsened due to a lack of rain. Now, into July, the heat has reached all time records. In Steele, North Dakota, temperatures reached 121°F (50°C). In Ohio, temperatures reached 110°F (43°C), which was close to tying a record high set in 1934. It comes in a time of major political unrest, with the America First Council a major force in Midwest Politics, Socialist and Syndicalist mobs and militias are gathering arms in the Great Lakes region. The drought is continuing, and there have been over 3000 reported deaths. Many people are suffering from heat stroke, and heat exhaustion. Farmers across the continent saw their worst harvest on record, causing corn and wheat prices to rise quickly and this Heat Wave does not seem to be giving up any time soon.

It was a joyful day in the General Staff. Champagne and caviar was on the tables and the Kaiser showed himself at his best. Mother Russia had been mauled as victorious German armies marched through St. Petersburg, Tsaritsyn and Moscow.  Everyone was now waiting for the Kaiser's decision. It was to be made public here at this very moment.
Chъxм, The Chinese New Year

Today begins the seven day long celebrations of the Chinese New Year. This is an especially important New Year, because it begins a new sixty year cycle, starting with the year of the Rat. It is the most important of the traditional Chinese holidays. The first day of Chinese New Year is a time when families visit the oldest and most senior member of their extended family, usually their parents, grandparents or great-grandparents.
Renri, The Final Day of Chъxм

The Security legislation has passed the first reading and is now before the House of Lords. Some fear the British exiles within the Upper House will kill the legislation. The House of Lords is now voting on the bill. It will be decided whether the changes made to the government, army, economy and domestic security remain.

Canada has been able to avoid the bitter class war that engulfed Britain after the Great War, but conflict between Anglo-Canadians and British exiles is growing. Some of this has lead to the development of several groups calling for rapproachment with the Union of Britain. The Tories want to crack down on these groups and have proposed that a new parliamentary committee be formed with executive power over the Royal Canadian Mounted Police and a new civilian intelligence agency with Conservative M.P. Robert Manion as its Chairman. Such a committee would be the first of its kind in Canada and would cut back on many civil liberties and union rights. Ernest Lapointe, the Solicitor-General, has suggested that some symbolic laws be passed to bring some of the Tories on side and that a weaker committee be created with Louis St. Laurent as its chairman, while the Progressives are adamant that no infringement of their civil rights take place. However, the issue is clear, Canada must re-organize and streamline it’s overly bureaucratic security forces.

When the revolution succeeded in Britain, it forced Canada to become the senior member of the Empire. While Canada was able to seize the Caribbean, we were unable to secure the rest of the Empire and had to rely on the Australasians to secure a perimeter around their territory. Many regard this as a result of our small army at that time, and many would like resurrect the conscription bill. However, the Prime Minister is a Liberal in the mold of Sir Wilfrid Laurier and will not lightly allow such a divisive law to be promulgated without intense debate. The conservatives want universal conscription, while the progressives within the Liberal party have threatened to leave if the government goes ahead. Conscription is deeply unpopular, especially in Quebec. The Prime Minister has declared “Conscription if necessary, but not necessarily conscription!” Many are taking this as a sign that he is working to build a consensus.

When the Great war began, the British Prime Minister Herbert Asquith said that industry would proceed as ‘Business as Usual’. The ensuing shell crisis and the difficulty found in equipping the British army has shown us that if another war were to start, we will need a mobilized war economy. However, most businessmen aren’t willing to invest in a specialized facilities such as Heavy Bomber factories that such an economy would require. Some Conservative MP’s are proposing that part of the Security bill include a provision to immediately nationalize such key war industries. While this wouldn’t increase the size of our industrial capacity, it would cut down on a lot of red tape. C.D. Howe, the minister of munitions, argues that the government subsidize the creation of such industries that entrepreneurs would lease at very preferable rates and provide the labour which would increase the number of factories, but limit their efficiency by working with the private sector. Some MP’s are arguing for a compromise where the government will nationalize the specialized industries that require a great deal of sophistication while subsidizing the more basic ones already in place.

When the Great war began, the British Prime Minister Herbert Asquith said that industry would proceed as ‘Business as Usual’. The ensuing shell crisis and the difficulty found in equipping the British army has shown us that if another war were to start, we will need a mobilized war economy. However, most businessmen aren’t willing to invest in a specialized facilities such as Heavy Bomber factories that such an economy would require. Some Conservative MP’s are proposing that part of the Security bill include a provision to immediately nationalize such key war industries. While this wouldn’t increase the size of our industrial capacity, it would cut down on a lot of red tape. C.D. Howe, the minister of munitions, argues that the government subsidize the creation of such industries that entrepreneurs would lease at very preferable rates and provide the labour which would increase the number of factories, but limit their efficiency by working with the private sector. Some MP’s are arguing for a compromise where the government will nationalize the specialized industries that require a great deal of sophistication while subsidizing the more basic ones already in place.

The King’s Ascension marks the beginning of a new era. The ad hoc and difficult task of strengthening Canadian industry, integrating the Royal Navy and finding a place for the hundreds of thousands of British Exiles has been a trying test for Canada, but we have survived the initial storm. We are stronger now, but now we must refine our strengths so that they will equal those of the other great powers. The Prime Minister and his government are therefore putting together a comprehensive security and military bill that will address the various national interests facing Canada. The legislation will be known as Bill C-7.

Prime Minister King’s government now has a comfortable majority after the defeat of R.B. Bennett’s conservative party and his British backers but not all is secure. George V is growing steadily worse in health and, despite his sickness, continues to oppose the moderating influence of the Prime Minister on Canadian politics. Senile and Obsessed with reclaiming the Empire, George V lends credibility to the British exiles who now sit in the Canadian House of Lords, (formerly known as the Senate before the Syndicalist revolt) whose presence in the upper house threatens to endanger the Prime Minister’s legislative program. While Canada has grown strong by an influx of expertise, capital and technology, it remains an uncertain player on the world stage. The next few years of King’s government will decisively shape the country’s future…

With his father dead, Edward the Prince of Wales will be coronated King-Emperor of the British Empire. Two large factions within the Canadian political sphere has coalesced, one led by the Prime Minister who seek to develop and refine Canada’s industrial strength and harvest its resources over foreign policy, and the other led by R.B. Bennett and his supporters in the British diaspora who wish to mobilize the Canadian economy to launch an invasion of the Union of Britain in the near future, even if that means accelerating arms production at the expense of civil liberties. The Prince of Wales is popular in both French and English Canada and his views may very well sway the opinions of others. He could prove to be vulnerable to the arguments of either group depending on how well they make their case to him…

The new King has been invested with the Royal Regalia in the First Anglican Church of Ottawa. Jubliant crowds from all over Canada gather in the cities to celebrate a new age of Canadian royalty! They eagerly anticipate the new King’s first radio address to the nation.

The King has spoken to the nation and has electrified it. From Vancouver to St. John, from Toronto to the Arctic, Canadians everywhere buzz with excitement after hearing a charismatic and forceful speech denouncing syndicalism and the King’s pledge to finish the war that his father began and reclaim Britain. Canadians were warned to never trust the Union of Britain or its insidious syndicalist allies!

Two weeks ago, Professional Austrian wrestler Adolf 'Hardcore' Hitler challenged Japan's top wrestler Chiyotenzan Takeyoshi to a standard wrestling match. Takeyoshi accepted, but only if the match were on Sacred Japanese soil, Hitler, without hesitation agreed and today they met for the first time in the ring. After 23 total minutes, Hitler won the match with his signature move, the 'Heil Driver'. The match was watched by wrestling fans all around the World, and the Painter turned Pro Wrestler even got a chance to meet with the Habsburg when he returned from Tokyo.
The Puerto Rican Nationalist Party Seizes the Capitol Building

Two weeks after being released from jail, the reason for his imprisonment being his viewpoints, Puerto Rican Nationalist Party leader Dr. Pedro Albizu Campos, or 'El Maestro' held a speech in San Juan Plaza, reinforcing his position that the Puerto Rican Nationalists should take whatever steps are necessary to gain Puerto Rico's independence. He pointed out what he saw as the hypocrisy of a United States crackdown on the Puerto Rican Nationalists, he argues that Puerto Rico has as much right to fight for their independence as the United States had in 1775. Three hours after his speech, at 21:45, Dr. Campos lead an armed party of Nationalists into the San Juan capitol building and replaced the American flag that was hoisted on the roof with the flag used by the rebels during the Lares Rebellion. Militias all across the island have followed the Doctor's lead. We have lost control of Puerto Rico.

We have forced the German monarchy to flee the country and liberated the German people. The war continues, but we are one step closer to liberating all of Europe! We have been contacted by Socialist and Syndicalist leaders alike in Rhineland, Bavaria, Northern Germany and Prussia who have decided to cooperate. By rewarding them, we could give them Independence, while watching over their shoulder of course. There is another option, giving only Rhineland their independence and occupying the rest of the country. Then, there is the most radical and costly option, occupy the whole country ourselves.

Three years from today, Father Charles Coughlin started doing weekly a radio broadcast in America and more than 50 million people turn on their radios and listen. He is a raving Anti-Semite, claiming that the Syndicalist Revolution in France was 'foremented by the Jew' and that the Berlin Stock Market Crash is an 'International Conspiracy of Jewish Baners' and somehow people still tune in. His hate-speech will not betolerated by the Church, and the Pope is expected to make a decision whether to ask the United States government to shut down his broadcast so his hateful message cannot reach the public.

Three years from today, Father Charles Coughlin started doing weekly radio broadcast on CBS and more than 50 million turn on their radios and listen. He is a raving Anti-Semite, claiming that the Syndicalist Revolution in France was 'foremented by the Jew' and that the Berlin Stock Market Crash is an 'International Conspiracy of Jewish Baners' and somehow people still tune in. The Roman Catholic Church has begun to take notice, and have condemnded his actions, asking that we shut his hate speech down immediately. He is a founding member of the dangerous and radical American First party and he claims if the America First doesn't get 10 million votes in the upcoming election he'll hang up his mic. We may be able to speed us his depature from CBS Radio and force him off the air by refusing to renew his permit.
La Troisiиme Internationale

Sao Paulo was hit hard by the Berlin Stock Market Crash. Brasil has a heavy dependence on foreign markets and loans. Despite limited industrial development in Sгo Paulo, the export of coffee and other primary products is still the mainstay of the economy. Days after the Berlin stock market crash, coffee quotations immediately fell 30 percent. The subsequent decline was even sharper.

Government policies are designed to favor foreign interests, which has exasperated the crisis we are facing, leaving the regime alienated from just about every segment of society. Following the Berlin panic, the government attempted to please foreign creditors by maintaining convertibility according to the money principles preached by the foreign bankers and economists who set the terms for Brazil's relations with the world economy, despite lacking any support from a single major sector in Brazilian society.

Syndicalist leader Astrojildo Pereira has been stirring up dissent in the coastal, urban cities of Brasil and he is beginning to gather a following. Many of the immigrants who came from Eastern and Southern Europe during and after the Great War brought ideas of Anarchism, Socialism and Syndicalism along with them and they have begun to root themselves into Brasilian politics. Brasil was hit by its first wave of general strikes and the establishment of the Syndicalist Party in 1921. Not to mention the Northeastern sugar barons have bitterly opposed Artur da Silva Bernardes since his inauguration and are rumored to be making an alliance with the Nationalists.

We are nearing the end of 1936 and already Brasil's gold reserves have been depleted, pushing the exchange rate down to a new low. World demand for Brasil's primary products have fallen far too drastically to maintain government revenues. The government is stuck in a deepening balance-of-payments crisis, and the coffee growers are struck with an unsellable harvest. Since power ultimately rests on patronage, wide-scale defections in the delicate balance of regional interests left the regime quite vulnerable.

Astrojildo Pereira, leader of the Brasilian Worker's Party has stepped up his efforts to undermine the Central Government. He has held a mass rally in the city of Brasilia and has called out for the resignation of President Artur da Silva Bernardes or he will storm the Palбcio do Planalto himself and force him and his cabinet to resign. if we dont do something, we may have a revolution on our hands.

The Palбcio do Planalto, The Presidential Palace has been surrounded by angry mob of peasants that came out of the Guetos after the arrest of Astrojildo Pereira in his home in Brasilia yesterday evening. The mob is calling for the resignation of President Artur da Silva Bernardes as well as the release of Astrojildo Pereira. Roughly 30 percent of the military is behind the mob, and a confrontation would be disastrous no matter the immediate results.

The Palбcio do Planalto, The Presidential Palace has been surrounded by angry mob of peasants that came out of the Guetos after a speech made by Astrojildo Pereira in Brasilia yesterday evening. The mob is calling for the resignation of President Artur da Silva Bernardes. Roughly 20 percent of the military is behind the mob, and a confrontation would be disastrous no matter the immediate results.

Yesterday, the Presidential Guard were given orders to crush the mob outside the Palace. The Presidential Guard, small in numbers, their morale at an all-time low refused to fire on their own country-men and went into hiding. Today, the President made a final radio adress and was found in his office with a gun-shot wound to the head. Now, the future of Brasil hangs in the balance. The Sugar Barons have been waiting for a moment like this, as well as the military.
Now that Artur da Silva Bernardes, Brasil has begun the transformation into a Syndicalist state where the Trade Unions control the means of Production with Astrojildo Pereira at the reigns.
In order to save Brasil from the grasps of Syndicalism, Dutra destroyed the mob that surrounded the palace after the President's suicide and took control of the Central Government.

In order to save Brasil from the grasps of Syndicalism, Getulio Vargas, after winning the support of the Middle-Class and the North Eastern Sugar Barons, dispearsed the mob that surrounded the palace after the President's suicide and took control of the Central Government.

Joaquнn Ascaso Budriб has taken the stage and elaborated the position of the CNT-FAI in Spain for the Congress. The CNT-FAI is the largest Syndicalist party in Spain, made up of Anarcho-Syndicalists, moderate Syndicalists and trade unionists. The Spanish Revolutionaries have been seen White Terror, violent counter-revolutionary actions taking against the Workers first-hand. They have come, asking for support for their cause when the moment comes.
